chargeHist.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)
Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Great Bodily Harm)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Oceana L Molla was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child -Specified Harm Did Not Occur And Child Under 6 Years Of Age, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 8/22/22 by 4:00 p.m.
Probation hearing November 11, 2022 at 1:30 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Provide DNA sample.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during period of probation. If revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC.  Remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures.
Court waives all nonmandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Parenting classes.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Cooperate with DMCPS and/or CHIPS court orders.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child -Specified Harm Did Not Occur And Child Under 6 Years Of Age

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oceana L Molla

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:   KERRI CLEGHORN   $950.00
of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County, signed and filed.

Defendant Oceana L Molla in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea and sentencing hearing held. State has filed an AMENDED information. Defense counsel acknowledges receipt, waives reading, and enters a temporary not guilty plea.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO AMENDED COUNT 1: The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 3 YEARS AND 6 MONTHS, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 1 YEAR AND 6 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 36 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Serve 120 DAYS in HOC as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Parenting classes.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Cooperate with DMCPS and/or CHIPS court orders.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA surcharge to be paid during period of probation, if revoked to be paid by defendant's prison funds at a percentage to be determined by the DOC, remainder to be paid during the period of extended supervision; failure to pay will result in a civil judgment subject to any applicable collection procedures. 
-Court WAIVES all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges, due to inability to pay.
-Provide DNA Sample.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
*Court ordered defendant to sign up for probation no later than 8/22/22 by 4:00 pm.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Instructions, filed.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, filed.
records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, filed.
Plea Agreement, filed.
Plea Questionnaire Waiver of Rights, filed.

Defendant Oceana L Molla in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests a plea and sentencing hearing.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Oceana L Molla in court with attorney Kerri Terann Cleghorn.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Christopher Heckman - Hales Corners PD Detective. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Parties address the no contact order. Court takes no action at this time. Case is adjourned to Branch 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
signed and filed.
State requests the no contact order be modified. Arguments heard. Court takes the request under advisement.

Defendant Oceana L Molla in court.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Kerri Cleghorn, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing will be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
to modify no contact order, filed.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 03/31/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with CC EXCEPT pursuant to current CPS supervision plan and any subsequent supervision plans and orders.

Prior: 9527 West Forest Home Avenue #16, Hales Corners, WI 53130
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Oceana L Molla in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Alexandria S. Carlson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 29.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
